alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 8:56AM CDT until March 26 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River near Tahlequah. * WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs from Hanging Rock downstream towards Tahlequah. Access roads east of the Combs Bridge near Eagles Bluff are impassable. Some cabins and parks may begin to flood. Extreme turbulence makes the river too hazardous for floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening, and continue rising to a crest of 14.9 feet early tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
